questions.question: What is the primary function of a database management system (DBMS)?
options: To store and retrieve data efficiently
To create user interfaces for applications
questions.correctAnswer: To store and retrieve data efficiently

questions.question: Which data structure uses a Last-In, First-Out (LIFO) approach?
questions.correctAnswer: Stack

questions.question: What does SQL stand for?
questions.correctAnswer: Structured Query Language

questions.question: What is the purpose of normalization in database design?
options: To reduce data redundancy and improve data integrity
questions.correctAnswer: To reduce data redundancy and improve data integrity

questions.question: What is a primary key in a relational database?
options: A unique identifier for each record
A field that contains foreign keys
A field that can contain null values
A field that indexes the table
questions.correctAnswer: A unique identifier for each record

questions.question: What is an ACID transaction?
questions.correctAnswer: Atomicity, Consistency, Isolation, Durability

questions.question: Which algorithm is commonly used for searching in a sorted array?
questions.correctAnswer: Binary Search

questions.question: What is polymorphism in object-oriented programming?
options: The ability to inherit properties from a parent class
The ability of an object to take on many forms
The ability to encapsulate data and methods
The ability to abstract away complex implementation details
questions.correctAnswer: The ability of an object to take on many forms

questions.question: What is the difference between a class and an object?
options: A class is a blueprint, an object is an instance of a class
A class is an instance, an object is a blueprint
A class is a method, an object is a variable
questions.correctAnswer: A class is a blueprint, an object is an instance of a class

questions.question: What is encapsulation in object-oriented programming?
options: Hiding internal details of an object
Inheriting properties from a parent class
Creating multiple methods with the same name
questions.correctAnswer: Hiding internal details of an object

questions.question: What is inheritance in object-oriented programming?
options: Creating new classes from existing classes
Hiding internal data from external access
questions.correctAnswer: Creating new classes from existing classes

questions.question: What is the purpose of a version control system (VCS)?
options: To manage source code and track changes
To compile code into executable files
To debug code and identify errors
To design user interfaces for applications
questions.correctAnswer: To manage source code and track changes

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common VCS?
questions.correctAnswer: MySQL

questions.question: What does REST stand for in web development?
questions.correctAnswer: Representational State Transfer

questions.question: What is an API?
questions.correctAnswer: Application Programming Interface

questions.question: What is a common use case for a queue data structure?
questions.correctAnswer: Managing tasks in a printer

questions.question: What is a linked list?
options: A linear data structure where each element points to the next
A non-linear data structure used for searching
questions.correctAnswer: A linear data structure where each element points to the next

questions.question: What is Big O notation used for?
questions.correctAnswer: Measuring the efficiency of algorithms

questions.question: What does O(n) represent in Big O notation?
questions.correctAnswer: Linear time complexity

questions.question: What is a hash table?
options: A data structure that uses hashing for fast data retrieval
questions.correctAnswer: A data structure that uses hashing for fast data retrieval

questions.question: What is recursion in programming?
options: A loop that iterates through an array
questions.correctAnswer: A function calling itself

questions.question: What is a deadlock in concurrent programming?
options: A situation where two or more processes are blocked indefinitely
A race condition where data is corrupted
questions.correctAnswer: A situation where two or more processes are blocked indefinitely

questions.question: What is the purpose of a software design pattern?
options: To provide reusable solutions to common programming problems
questions.correctAnswer: To provide reusable solutions to common programming problems

questions.question: Which design pattern promotes loose coupling between objects?
questions.correctAnswer: Observer

questions.question: What is the purpose of a software testing framework?
questions.correctAnswer: To automate testing processes

questions.question: What is unit testing?
options: Testing the entire system as a whole
questions.correctAnswer: Testing individual components of software

questions.question: What is integration testing?
options: Testing the interaction between different components of software
Testing the entire system with real users
Testing the performance of the software
questions.correctAnswer: Testing the interaction between different components of software

questions.question: What is system testing?
options: Testing the entire system as a whole
Testing the performance of the software
questions.correctAnswer: Testing the entire system as a whole

questions.question: What is the purpose of a load balancer?
options: Distributing network traffic across multiple servers
questions.correctAnswer: Distributing network traffic across multiple servers

questions.question: What is a microservice architecture?
options: An architectural style that structures an application as a collection of small, autonomous services
questions.correctAnswer: An architectural style that structures an application as a collection of small, autonomous services
